thread.title: Pan bombs while The Martian stays number one at US box office - Movies
thread.title_full: Pan bombs while The Martian stays number one at US box office - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Kristina Bustos
title: Pan bombs while The Martian stays number one at US box office - Movies
text: The Martian has remained the number one movie for the second week at the US box office.Starring Matt Damon and Jessica Chastain, the Ridley Scott-directed movie took in $37m, adding to its total of $108.7m. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID); modVP = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.VIDEO_PLAYER); modExp = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.EXPERIENCE); modCon = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.CONTENT); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.BEGIN, onVideoStart); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.STOP, onVideoStop); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.PROGRESS, onVideoProgress); } #_containermyExperience4440113536001 { height: 100%; } // InSkin integration parameters: InSkinParams['myInSkin14440113536001'] = { 'srv_SectionID': '', 'srv_SectionIDPlay': '123757', 'srv_Keywords': '', 'plr_ContentID': 'myExperience4440113536001', 'plr_ContentType': 'BRIGHTCOVE3', 'plr_ContentW': 558, 'plr_ContentH': 314, 'plr_NoSkinContentResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinContentW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinContentH': 348, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinH': 348, 'plr_ResizeOnHideSkin': true, 'plr_HideSkinOnExternalAd': 'all', 'plr_ShowSkinAfterExternalAd': true, 'cnt_SmartPlayer': true }; // create the InSkin object: var InSkinObject4440113536001 = new InSkin.Base('myInSkin14440113536001'); brightcove.createExperiences(); if (!navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i)) { InSkinObject4440113536001.init(); ai_type="video"; } Hotel Transylvania 2 and The Intern also kept their spots from last weekend - the former at second place with $20.3m and the latter at fourth place with $8.6m.Meanwhile, Pan had an unimpressive debut, landing at third place with $15.5m. Starring Hugh Jackman, Rooney Mara and Garrett Hedlund, Pan tells the story of how a young orphan boy named Peter became the hero known as Peter Pan. Â© Warner Bros Pictures The Walk, on the other hand, managed to climb up from last weekend's eleventh spot to seventh place with $3.6m. Starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, The Walk tells the real-life story of high-wire artist Philippe Petit's dream to to walk between the World Trade Centre towers in 1974.Sicaro slipped two spots to fifth place with $7.3m, followed by Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials in sixth place with $5.2m.Black Mass at eight with $3.1m, Everest at ninth with $3m and The Visit at tenth with $2.4m round up the top ten list at the US box office.The US weekend box office top 10 for October 9-11 (studio estimates) is as follows:1. (1) The Martian - $37,000,000 2. (2) Hotel Transylvania 2 - $20,300,0003. (-) Pan - $15,530,000 4. (4) The Intern - $8,660,000 5. (3) Sicario - $7,350,000 6. (5) Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials - $5,250,000 7. (11) The Walk - $3,650,000 8. (6) Black Mass - $3,130,0009. (7) Everest (2015) - $3,030,00010. (8) The Visit - $2,420,000
